meanings.definition: A cowlstave is a wooden stave or strip used in making a cask or barrel.
meanings.sent1: The cowlstaves were carefully crafted to build the sturdy barrel.
meanings.sent2: The cooper selected the finest cowlstaves for the new wine cask.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the cowlstaves as a makeshift slide in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like cowlstaves, piecing together a story with each new detail.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of oak mingled with the cowlstaves, creating a rich scent in the cellar.

meanings.definition: Cowlstaves can also refer to the curved pieces of wood forming the sides of a cowl or hood.
meanings.sent1: The cowlstaves gracefully framed the face of the mysterious figure.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the cowlstaves of her cloak to shield herself from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten peeked out from under the cowlstaves, thinking it was hiding.
meanings.sent4: His laughter echoed under the cowlstaves of the ancient tree, filling the forest.
meanings.sent5: The wind whispered secrets through the gaps in the cowlstaves, carrying stories of old.
